intro: Cyrtochilum lapacense, commonly known as the Lapacense orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers with a distinctive coloration. The plant typically has dark green, leathery leaves and is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments. Cyrtochilum lapacense belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is part of the Orchidaceae family. It is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
